str2: Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To raise up, set up; I rise from among (the) dead; I arise, appear. From ana and histemi; to stand up.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
(a) adj: dead, lifeless, subject to death, mortal, (b) noun: a dead body, a corpse. From an apparently primary nekus; dead.
No longer, no more. From me and eti; no further.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: A strengthened form of melo; to intend, i.e. Be about to be, do, or suffer something.
Destruction, decay, corruption. From diaphtheiro; decay.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Probably a fuller form of rheo; an alternate for epo in certain tenses; to utter, i.e. Speak or say.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Holy, pious, godly, beloved of God. Of uncertain affinity; properly, right, i.e. Hallowed.
Trustworthy, faithful, believing. From peitho; objectively, trustworthy; subjectively, trustful.
David, King of Israel. Of Hebrew origin; Dabid, the Israelite king.
